item.title: Nikki add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "People always think that happiness is a faraway thing," thought Francie, "something complicated and hard to get. Yet, what little things can make it up; a place of shelter when it rains - a cup of strong hot coffee when you're blue; for a man, a cigarette for contentment; a book to read when you're alone - just to be with someone you love. Those things make happiness." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Sarah Orne Jewett
item.description: "To let God make us, instead of painfully trying to make ourselves; to follow the path that his love shows us, instead of through conceit or cowardice or mockery choosing another; to trust Him for our strength and fitness as the flowers do, simply giving ourselves back to Him in grateful service,—this is to keep the laws that give us the freedom of the city in which there is no longer any night of bewilderment or ignorance or uncertainty." -- Sarah Orne Jewett

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I had not intended to love him; the reader knows I had wrought hard to extirpate from my soul the germs of love there detected; and now, at the first renewed view of him, they spontaneously revived, great and strong! He made me love him without looking at me." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Sarah Orne Jewett
item.description: "This is a very small world; we are all within hail of each other. I dare say when we get to Heaven there will not be a stranger to make friends with. -A Country Doctor" -- Sarah Orne Jewett

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I will keep the law given by God; sanctioned by man. Laws and principles are not for the times when there is no temptation: they are for such moments as this, when body and soul rise in mutiny against their rigour; stringent are they; inviolate they shall be. If at my individual convenience I might break them, what would be their worth?" -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Sarah Orne Jewett
item.description: "It seems to me like stealing, for men and women to live in the world and do nothing to make it better." -- Sarah Orne Jewett

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "...for love casts out fear, and gratitude can conquer pride." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Sarah Orne Jewett
item.description: "There are plenty of people dragging themselves miserably through the world, because they are clogged and fettered with work for which they have no fitness...I can't help believing that nothing is better than to find one's work early and hold fast to it, and put all one's heart into it. - A Country Doctor" -- Sarah Orne Jewett

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Sarah Orne Jewett
item.description: "It is a splendid thing to have the use of any gift of God. It isn't for us to choose again, or wonder and dispute, but just work in our own places, and leave the rest to God." -- Sarah Orne Jewett

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "The children were sent to bed. Some went submissively; others with shrieks and protests as they were dragged away. They had been permitted to sit up till after the ice-cream, which naturally marked the limit of human indulgence. " -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "She missed him the days when some pretext served to take him away from her, just as one misses the sun on a cloudy day without having thought much about the sun when it was shining. " -- Kate Chopin
